title: Additively Manufactured Nickel Aluminum Bronze via Laser Powder Bed Fusion Shows Excellent Anticorrosion
content: Nickel aluminum bronze (NAB) has gained considerable attention due to its enhanced mechanical and anti-corrosive properties and applicability for marine and other industries [1]. Additive manufacturing (AM) of NAB has revolutionized the production of intricate NAB components, promising unprecedented design flexibility and reduced material wastage [2-3]. Here, laser powder bed fusion (LPBF) of NAB powder (specifically Cu-9.8Al-5.2Ni-4.6Fe-0.3Mn by wt. %), was optimized to manufacture dense AM specimens producing a net-shape component with very high cooling rates. As compared to conventional casting (0.1-100 K/s), the cooling rates during LBPF are significantly higher (103-108 K/s). Metals fabricated by LPBF can also be significantly stronger compared to their cast or wrought counterparts due to their refined microstructure [4].
